Articles.Content: Some people even become more volumetric every day passes.

On 10/3/2022 at 7:52 AM, blackrack said:

One day before ksp 2

I can’t tell if this means someday between now and KSP 2’s release, or if it’s exactly the day before KSP 2’s release. I choose to believe the latter because that’d be 10x as hilarious.

Hey, @blackrack quick question- you have said there will be decal cloud formations with the volumetric cloud release, but will we be able to configure large scale 3d formations? By this I mean like polar votices on gas giants, or large scale storms, and large duststorm fronts (like the ones we see on mars 100s of kilometers across.) Sorry if this is too early to ask.

4 hours ago, Benzo Kerman said:

Hey, @blackrack quick question- you have said there will be decal cloud formations with the volumetric cloud release, but will we be able to configure large scale 3d formations? By this I mean like polar votices on gas giants, or large scale storms, and large duststorm fronts (like the ones we see on mars 100s of kilometers across.) Sorry if this is too early to ask.

Yes, decals will offer a way to mix layers in a single layer basically (I also plan to have the decals be configurable in time, as in they can fade in/out and only appear at configured times). All these formations can be done already without decals they are just more static. I gotta finish up some things on the technical side then start making configs and showing off stuff like dust storms.

Edited October 6, 2022 by blackrack

This marks my 2nd dream about a KSP mod release: I was flying a private jet at night with volumetric clouds and rain, and there was a bug that caused the runway to always look wet. Of course, as it was raining, it worked fine.

I do wonder whether rain would be possible with, say, really big sheets with rain textures falling from clouds...

6 hours ago, LHACK4142 said:

This marks my 2nd dream about a KSP mod release: I was flying a private jet at night with volumetric clouds and rain, and there was a bug that caused the runway to always look wet. Of course, as it was raining, it worked fine.

I do wonder whether rain would be possible with, say, really big sheets with rain textures falling from clouds...

I have also been having a recurring dream where I imagine kerbal weather mod feeding into the Dev volumetric clouds creating global and dynamic clouds with wind, up drafts and storms all occuring naturally

The wet runway bug was actually a real bug...

While new clouds and other mods such as scatterer and parallax make game absolutely beautiful, There's one thing really bugs me. Lighting on our vehicles. It's just terrible, out of scene and environment. Shame it stuck like this after all these years.
